AD_LaezelPostConfrontation.synopsis: Non-recruited Lae'zel speaks ADs after the battle with the dragon rider. She alternated between the beat of the dragon rider and looking for a creche.

PAD_LaezelKilledByGith.synopsis: Player returning to the Gith Chokepoint area after leaving Lae'zel behind -- she has been killed by the gith

AD_LaezelBetrayed.synopsis: |Lae'zel Companion only: the player attacked the gith during 'PLA_GithChokepoint_ConfrontationLaezel', and Voss commanded Baretha to kill them all (the player + Lae'zel) OR, the situation naturally ended in combat. Lae'zel is betrayed, and this AD makes it clear to the player.|

ReadingMap.synopsis: |Item interaction: player clicks on the githyanki map and tries to read it. Githyanki are able to read it.Lae'zel is added in the 3th speaker slot. Any others are in the second slot. If Lae'zel is taking the map from somebody, they are both speakers in the dialog. Otherwise the second or third slot are null.

Confrontation.synopsis: Our party encounters a band of githyanki warriors who have taken position at bottleneck in the region - a bridge that provides one of the few paths of progression. The gith confront us and try to see if we know anything about the 'weapon' they seek. (The weapon in question is the strange puzzle box we are carrying.) While reading our thoughts, the githyanki may realise we are tadpoled, resulting in instant combat. If we manage to conceal our tadpoles, they may allow us to pass.

PAD_Shield.synopsis: Comment on acquiring or moving a shield of a Flaming Fist mercenary killed by the dragon on the bridge.

PAD_LeavingLaezelBehind.synopsis: |Lae'zel, who was a companion, is being left behind at the Gith Chokepoint. The remaining companions can react to it (AVATAR are excluded from this VB, so this VB may not play in multiplayer when all characters are avatars.)

AD_LaezelWithKnight.synopsis: |Lae'zel was a companion. She became a NPC and ran up to the gith. Now she's looping this AD with the Knight until the player comes closer or leaves.|

ZorruFriend_Dead.synopsis: Yul was Zorru's friend. Player finds him dead already and may have heard about him before if they talked to Zorru with Lae'zel.
ZorruFriend_Dead.how_to_trigger: Find Yul's corpse in the Gith Chokepoint area

TieflingScout.synopsis: A tiefling scout from the Druid Grove hides and observes as a Githyanki war party massacres some Flaming Fists. The tiefling may warn the player that they are too weak to take on such opponents, before running off.

PAD_LaezelReadMap.synopsis: After reading the Githyanki Map, Lae'zel Avatar urges the rest of the party to go to the crèche.

AD_GithCaptainFirstTurn.synopsis: Small remark that the players don't stand a chance.
AD_GithCaptainFirstTurn.how_to_trigger: Plays on S_GLO_GithCaptain's first turn in combat.

AD_ScoutLeaves.synopsis: The tiefling refugee/scout declares she's clearing off when she realises the situation with the nearby githyanki warparty is getting too risky.

ConfrontationLaezel.synopsis:
Alternate version of the dragon rider scene at chokepoint. Lae'zel is alive and was never recruited. Player can recruit her after this.

Lae'zel approaches the rider to discover where to find the creche. A cure for the tadpole can be found there - or so she believes. However, the knight is under different orders.

PAD_DragonShadow.synopsis: A dragon flies over the party. They may or may not  recognise it. If they're a gith, they'll always recognise it and suppose that their kin must be operating nearby.

AD_LaezelRunsToKnight.synopsis: Non-recruited Lae'zel calls out to the gith knight.

AD_StandOff.synopsis: A flaming fist solider nervously attempts to challenge a githyanki warrior. The gith is essentially an alien to the lowly soldier; he can't help but feel intimidated.

CINE_RiderAndDragonLeave.synopsis: Cinematic: Kith'rak Voss flies away on his dragon.The player interrupted the Gith Chokepoint situation. The most likely interruption is triggering a combat (player attacks any npc there including Voss or the dragon, or drags another hostile npc near them)This interruption happens in gameplay, so normally the Rider (Kith'rak Voss) and the Dragon would also leave in gameplay, but animations don't have the tech support to make the Rider ride the dragon like this, so we play this cutscene instead

PAD_LaezelPostFight.synopsis: |Lae'zel avatar says this after killing the other giths at the Gith Chokepoint. Hints at looting the corpses and eventually finding the map. Lae'zel companion has a relation dialog instead of this PAD.|

AD_SearchingCorpses.synopsis: Kith'rak Voss, a high-ranking gith warrior, berates his underling, Sarth Baretha, and orders her and her warriors to search the corpses of some humans they'rve just killed. They are looking for 'the weapon' (in fact a strange puzzle box in the possession of our party).

DragonEvent.synopsis: A Flaming Fist detachment tries to confront a githyanki war band. The Flaming Fists are completely outmatched, however; the githyanki warriors dismiss their demands. Moments later, a githyanki controlled dragon roasts the Flaming Fists in a fly-by. Afterwards, the dragon rider, a senior gith, berates his subordinate for her slow mission progress.

PartyReaction.synopsis: Companions react to the gith chokepoint (dragon flew by and killed the flaming fists). Lae'zel is handled in a different dialog.

AD_ScoutReactsToDragon.synopsis: A tiefling refugee observes a war party of githyanki warriors guarding a bottleneck in the main road leading out of the region. The githyanki are alien and fearsome to the tiefling. She reacts with shock when she sees how they have a dragon circling overhead in support.

AD_LaezelSidesWithGith.synopsis: |Player manually attacked the githyanki, bypassing the normal flow. Lae'zel is still a NPC. She sides with the githyanki in this combat.|

automatic_ordering.reasoning: By reading through the sessions’ synopses we can infer some narrative dependencies. First, the events concerning Lae'zel being left behind and then later found deceased indicate that the session PAD_LeavingLaezelBehind (where she is abandoned) must occur before PAD_LaezelKilledByGith (where she is found killed). Next, the ReadingMap session (when the player examines the githyanki map) logically occurs before PAD_LaezelReadMap, where Lae'zel (now an avatar) comments after reading the map. In another chain, the appearance of a dragon in the DragonEvent leads to a reaction by a tiefling character in AD_ScoutReactsToDragon; thus DragonEvent must precede AD_ScoutReactsToDragon. A further cluster of events centers on the alternate confrontation with Lae'zel at the chokepoint (ConfrontationLaezel). In that session the player’s handling of the encounter can lead to one of three mutually exclusive outcomes – if the player attacks the gith, either AD_LaezelBetrayed or AD_LaezelSidesWithGith will play, while a more neutral progression leads to AD_LaezelWithKnight. In all three cases the trigger is the ConfrontationLaezel event. In addition, there is a potential alternative with the tiefling scout: the session TieflingScout (in which she warns the player as she observes the massacre) and AD_ScoutLeaves (where the tiefling explicitly declares she is leaving due to the danger) represent alternative outcomes for that character and so are mutually exclusive. Only sessions with ordering or exclusiveness constraints are included in the final response.

AD_LaezelPostConfrontation_1.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelPostConfrontation_1.text: Protocol is clear. I will be purified.

AD_LaezelPostConfrontation_2.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelPostConfrontation_2.text: The knight has betrayed his Queen's children. He will be punished.

PAD_LaezelKilledByGith_2.speaker: Player
PAD_LaezelKilledByGith_2.text: Dead - by her own kin's hand.

AD_LaezelBetrayed_0.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelBetrayed_0.text: Traitors to our queen: I will make you suffer!
AD_LaezelBetrayed_0.context: NodeContext: Calls out after battle starts.

Confrontation_134.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_134.text: You are unknown to me, kin. Are you straight from the crèche, wandering unbidden?

Confrontation_202.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_202.text: You are unknown to me, kin. Are you straight from the crèche, wandering unbidden?
Confrontation_202.context: InternalNodeContext: Do not put a selection speaker here, gith has priority

Confrontation_41.speaker: Player
Confrontation_41.text: Honestly? I'm not really a gith.

Confrontation_61.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_61.text: Tsk'va! You seek to impersonate us? To spy on us?

Confrontation_58.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_58.text: Baretha! Kill this fiend. I will continue to hunt for the weapon elsewhere.

Confrontation_161.speaker: Player
Confrontation_161.text: Play along as a gith. Say you're indeed from the crèche.

Confrontation_10.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_10.text: Lies. You speak like the vermin from this wretched world. What are you, a deserter?

Confrontation_168.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_168.text: No matter. Baretha! This one is no kin to us. Kill them. I will continue searching for the weapon.

Confrontation_27.speaker: Player
Confrontation_27.text: Impersonate a fierce gith and refuse him any explanation.

Confrontation_196.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_196.text: Ha! Your tongue is sharp - good. The crèche's hatchlings have not been compromised by this meek, wretched world.

Confrontation_251.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_251.text: There is no conviction in your voice. What are you? A deserter? A traitor?

Confrontation_63.speaker: Player
Confrontation_63.text: Show deference. Bow and explain that you are lost.

Confrontation_101.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_101.text: Pa'vrylk! You twist our noble words with a coward's tongue!

Confrontation_213.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_213.text: This world has made you soft, like rotten fruit. I will not let you shame Vlaakith any longer...

Confrontation_34.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_34.text: Baretha! Rid us of this disgrace. I have to continue my hunt for the weapon.

Confrontation_54.speaker: Player
Confrontation_54.text: I am no crèche hatchling. Do not speak to me as one.

Confrontation_114.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_114.text: Ha! Your tongue is still sharp - good. This soft world can dull our wits.

Confrontation_74.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_74.text: We must not linger among such cattle. Even their warriors' blood shames our blades.

Confrontation_164.speaker: Player
Confrontation_164.text: Tell him about your parasite and ask for help.

Confrontation_240.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_240.text: I believe you, vin'iisk. No one would lie about such a thing.

Confrontation_7.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_7.text: Your troubles are over; we shall help you. Baretha?

Confrontation_152.speaker: Player
Confrontation_152.text: Indeed. I came from the crèche.

Confrontation_201.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_201.text: Curious. Most coming from the crèche would come across this bridge behind me. You did not...

Confrontation_112.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_112.text: ...but I suppose you are young and untested. This world can be confounding to navigate.

Confrontation_191.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_191.text: You will return to the crèche and fetch reinforcements. But first, a question...

Confrontation_31.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_31.text: And in the company of local vermin...? Explain yourself, vin'iisk.

Confrontation_220.speaker: Player
Confrontation_220.text: These are my comrades. I will not stoop to explain my choice of company.

Confrontation_212.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_212.text: Insubordinate at best. A blood traitor and deserter at worst.

Confrontation_190.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_190.text: Baretha - kill them and search the bodies. I will hunt for the weapon elsewhere.

Confrontation_157.speaker: Player
Confrontation_157.text: They are my prisoners. I intend to bring them to the crèche for interrogation.

Confrontation_137.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_137.text: How diligent you are, vin'iisk. If only all of our queen's warriors served with such rigour.

Confrontation_95.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_95.text: Take them to the crèche. And see about fetching reinforcements. But first, a question...

Confrontation_1.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_1.text: We hunt a weapon, taken from the ghaik slave ship. Have you seen such an item?

Confrontation_125.speaker: Narrator
Confrontation_125.text: *You feel Shadowheart's anxiety. The weapon that Voss seeks is the same one the Absolute's followers are hunting - it's the artefact that she carries.*
Confrontation_125.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart steals a glance to Tav, her expression tight, apprehensive. The image of her undulates slightly - a mindmeld.InternalNodeContext: This node if the 'find the weapon' beat was previously delivered by Dror Ragzlin

Confrontation_252.speaker: Narrator
Confrontation_252.text: *Her mind focuses - the giths' suspicion cannot be aroused. They cannot discover that the weapon they seek is right within their grasp.*
Confrontation_252.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart's eyes flick over to the hobgoblin.

Confrontation_76.speaker: Player
Confrontation_76.text: I need to know more. What is its appearance? Its purpose?

Confrontation_68.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_68.text: It is polyhedric in shape, inscribed with the sacred runes of our people. It is our queen's, and she shall have it back.

Confrontation_188.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_188.text: Clearly you know nothing of this, vin'iisk. No matter, it will be found. Make for the crèche.

Confrontation_6.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_6.text: And if you come across any survivors of the ghaik vessel, kill them and search them. Thoroughly.

Confrontation_21.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_21.text: Baretha - keep hunting. And do better. Qudenos - we fly!

Confrontation_19.speaker: Player
Confrontation_19.text: I don't know of such a weapon.

Confrontation_203.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_203.text: No matter. More spears will make short work of this hunt. Make for the crèche.

Confrontation_248.speaker: Player
Confrontation_248.text: Produce the artefact. Ask him if this is what he seeks.

Confrontation_84.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_84.text: It cannot be... You have the weapon? Someone would have reported it to me.

Confrontation_222.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_222.text: Unless... unless you carried it off the ghaik ship yourself.

Confrontation_187.speaker: Narrator
Confrontation_187.text: *You realise he is casting Detect Thoughts. You feel him rummaging in your head already.*

Confrontation_163.speaker: Narrator
Confrontation_163.text: *You feel a presence in your head - the kith'rak's presence. Your tadpole recoils defensively.*

Confrontation_24.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_24.text: ...It is true. You were corrupted by the filthy spawn of the ghaik. Yet you still retrieved our queen's weapon.

Confrontation_64.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_64.text: You have done well, in spite of your affliction. Allow me to reward you. Baretha?

Confrontation_22.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_22.text: Kill them. Make it swift and clean.

Confrontation_184.speaker: Narrator
Confrontation_184.text: *You feel Shadowheart's anxiety. The weapon that Voss seeks - it's the artefact that she carries.*
Confrontation_184.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart steals a glance to Tav, her expression tight, apprehensive. The image of her undulates slightly - a mindmeld.

Confrontation_165.speaker: Narrator
Confrontation_165.text: *You realise that the weapon Voss speaks of is the gith artefact you carry. You must keep it from him, just as you must keep it from the Absolute.*
Confrontation_165.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the 'find the weapon' beat was previously delivered by Dror Ragzlin

Confrontation_146.speaker: Narrator
Confrontation_146.text: *You realise that the weapon Voss speaks of is the gith artefact you carry. You cannot let him discover it - no matter what.*

Confrontation_211.speaker: Narrator
Confrontation_211.text: *You suddenly feel a strange anxiety take hold - not your own, but that of the artefact you carry. Somehow, it's afraid...*
Confrontation_211.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player glances to their side, as if sensing the box

Confrontation_205.speaker: Narrator
Confrontation_205.text: *You attune your mind to it. The artefact does not want to fall into the gith raiders' hands any more than it does the Absolute followers'.*
Confrontation_205.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the 'find the weapon' beat was previously delivered by Dror Ragzlin

Confrontation_97.speaker: Narrator
Confrontation_97.text: *You attune your mind to it. The artefact does not want to part from you. It does not want to fall into the gith raiders' hands.*

Confrontation_144.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_144.text: Your lips spill falsehoods! You have taken on the soft, cowardly ways of this world.

Confrontation_35.speaker: Player
Confrontation_35.text: These are local guides. I'll get rid of them once they cease to be useful.

Confrontation_83.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_83.text: Cunning. You will do well, vin'iisk.

Confrontation_145.speaker: Player
Confrontation_145.text: In the gith tongue, explain that they are local guides - to be killed once they cease to be useful.

Confrontation_233.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_233.text: Treacherous shka'keth! Baretha - deal with this! I will continue the hunt elsewhere.

Confrontation_263.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_263.text: What easy prey you make, walking right within my blade's embrace.

Confrontation_153.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_153.text: These creatures are so simple to ensnare, Baretha. You mewl too much about your task.

Confrontation_116.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_116.text: And as for you, tell me - why shouldn't I run you through this instant?

Confrontation_42.speaker: Player
Confrontation_42.text: Silently hold his stare and discreetly prepare to attack.

Confrontation_18.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_18.text: Hmm. You make good use of silence. Too many think hot air will save them...

Confrontation_25.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_25.text: If I have no use for you alive, I'll have your death, slow and sweet. Understand?

Confrontation_268.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_268.text: ...You think I don't see that pathetic fumbling?

Confrontation_173.speaker: Player
Confrontation_173.text: You would've done so already if you didn't want something from me first.

Confrontation_223.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_223.text: Perceptive, for such an inferior creature.

Confrontation_253.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_253.text: For you to keep sucking air, it is necessary for you to tell me something of worth.

Confrontation_80.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_80.text: A vessel fell from the sky. We seek a precious weapon that was taken from it.

Confrontation_249.speaker: Narrator
Confrontation_249.text: *You feel Shadowheart's anxiety. The weapon that Voss seeks is the same one the Absolute's followers are hunting - it's the artefact that she carries.*
Confrontation_249.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart steals a glance to Tav, her expression tight, apprehensive. The image of her undulates slightly - a mindmeld.InternalNodeContext: This node if the 'find the weapon' beat was previously delivered by Dror Ragzlin

Confrontation_109.speaker: Narrator
Confrontation_109.text: *You feel Shadowheart's anxiety. The weapon that Voss seeks - it's the artefact that she carries.*
Confrontation_109.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart steals a glance to Tav, her expression tight, apprehensive. The image of her undulates slightly - a mindmeld.

Confrontation_105.speaker: Narrator
Confrontation_105.text: *Her mind focuses - the giths' suspicion cannot be aroused. They cannot discover that the weapon they seek is right within their grasp.*
Confrontation_105.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart's eyes flick over to the hobgoblin.

Confrontation_59.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_59.text: Help us find it and I will leave your blood beneath your skin, unspilled.

Confrontation_111.speaker: Shadowheart
Confrontation_111.text: Don't help them. Don't tell them a thing. We're dead if you do.

Confrontation_170.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_170.text: Of course! Obedience is your only hope. Now stand still...

Confrontation_90.speaker: Player
Confrontation_90.text: You'll need to start from the beginning - what is this weapon you're after?

Confrontation_106.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_106.text: Do not speak. Your bleating offends my ears. Just stand still...

Confrontation_225.speaker: Player
Confrontation_225.text: Produce the artefact. Ask if this is what he seeks.

Confrontation_194.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_194.text: Just like that, you offer up what I seek. Remarkable. You have my thanks.

Confrontation_169.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_169.text: In gratitude, I'll grant you a swift death. Baretha? You know what to do.

Confrontation_11.speaker: Player
Confrontation_11.text: I might know something. But it'll cost you.

Confrontation_245.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_245.text: You haggle with your own life, fool. Be silent and hold still...

Confrontation_104.speaker: Narrator
Confrontation_104.text: *He begins to move his hand in a quick flurry of gestures.*
Confrontation_104.context: CinematicNodeContext: #	Dialog/ Scene	NodeGUID	Character Type & Sex 	Shot Name	Clips	Notes (Please include props here) 	Selects	Status	Record Date	Complexity 	Clean Up Length	Date Expected Final In Engine?NodeContext: Narration.

Confrontation_183.speaker: Player
Confrontation_183.text: Silently interpret the meaning of the gestures.

Confrontation_29.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_29.text: Ts'kva! You carry a ghaik parasite in your head! Death will be a kindness to you...

Confrontation_159.speaker: Player
Confrontation_159.text: Resist the probing into your mind.

Confrontation_209.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_209.text: Bah! Nothing even approaching a useful thought in that skull. I ought to just kill you...

Confrontation_4.speaker: Player
Confrontation_4.text: Don't be too hasty. I could prove very useful.

Confrontation_81.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_81.text: Unlikely. But it costs me nothing to spare your sorry life.

Confrontation_210.speaker: Player
Confrontation_210.text: I could help if you let me live - search for this weapon, perhaps.

Confrontation_195.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_195.text: Unlikely you'd be successful... but it costs me nothing to spare your sorry life.

Confrontation_120.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_120.text: Help? Absurd. You're already a hindrance, wasting my time.

Confrontation_143.speaker: Player
Confrontation_143.text: Why are you hesitating, then? Try it, I dare you.

Confrontation_218.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_218.text: So bold in the face of death... Perhaps you may live after all.

Confrontation_12.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_12.text: Better to let stronger blood thrive. It can give rise to worthier foes and hardier slaves. Don't disappoint me.

Confrontation_219.speaker: Player
Confrontation_219.text: You ought to just leave. You've no right to decide my fate.

Confrontation_231.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_231.text: My blade is my right. If I can take your life, it is mine. But perhaps you have other uses...

Confrontation_243.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_243.text: Very well, istik. Seek out survivors from the ship that crashed on this wretched world.

Confrontation_147.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_147.text: Bring me their heads. Bring me the weapon. If you succeed, the reward will be great.

Confrontation_2.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_2.text: I have every right: I am strong, you are weak.

Confrontation_77.speaker: Player
Confrontation_77.text: You saw how ruthlessly I pursue my goals. I can help you.

Confrontation_246.speaker: Player
Confrontation_246.text: My fate is my own. You will not take it from me.

Confrontation_119.speaker: Player
Confrontation_119.text: Give it a try. I'm hungry for a little fun.

Confrontation_5.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_5.text: A worthless kill - no sport. If this one was even slightly useful, I might spare them...
Confrontation_5.context: NodeContext: 'Voss' refers to Baretha's superior, who had recently chastised her lack of progress while the player observed from afar.

Confrontation_14.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_14.text: You think you can worm your way into my head, simpleton?

Confrontation_102.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_102.text: Baretha! Show this worm its place. I need to continue my hunt.

Confrontation_67.speaker: Player
Confrontation_67.text: Don't be foolish. I have powerful allies.

Confrontation_166.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_166.text: Then they can mourn for you.

Confrontation_15.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_15.text: Baretha! Rid us of this worm. I need to continue the hunt for the weapon.

Confrontation_79.speaker: Player
Confrontation_79.text: A corpse is useless. But a living informant might unearth something.

Confrontation_89.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_89.text: Curious. I thought even the lowest of creatures had at least a shred of dignity. You prove me wrong.

Confrontation_32.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_32.text: But there's a repellent logic in your words. You may notice things a noble gith does not.

Confrontation_86.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_86.text: Baretha! Kill this insolent worm. I need to continue my hunt.

Confrontation_87.speaker: Narrator
Confrontation_87.text: *The gestures mean nothing to you - some sort of spell that you don't recognise.*

Confrontation_167.speaker: Player
Confrontation_167.text: He is casting Detect Thoughts - steel your mind to resist it.

Confrontation_257.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_257.text: Well now. If you are of no use to me alive, I'll have your death.

Confrontation_171.speaker: Player
Confrontation_171.text: Lie. Claim you saw bandits loot a wreck, then set off to the west.

Confrontation_208.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_208.text: Oh you saw something, did you? Let us see exactly what these bandits took...

Confrontation_262.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_262.text: Help us find it and I will leave your blood beneath your skin, unspilled.

Confrontation_123.speaker: Narrator
Confrontation_123.text: *You realise that the weapon Voss speaks of is the gith artefact you carry. You must keep it from him, just as you must keep it from the Absolute.*
Confrontation_123.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the 'find the weapon' beat was previously delivered by Dror Ragzlin

Confrontation_241.speaker: Narrator
Confrontation_241.text: *You realise that the weapon Voss speaks of is the gith artefact you carry. You cannot let him discover it - no matter what.*

Confrontation_238.speaker: Narrator
Confrontation_238.text: *You suddenly feel a strange anxiety take hold - not your own, but that of the artefact you carry. Somehow, it's afraid...*
Confrontation_238.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player glances to their side, as if sensing the box

Confrontation_235.speaker: Narrator
Confrontation_235.text: *You attune your mind to it. The artefact does not want to fall into the gith raiders' hands any more than it does the Absolute followers'.*
Confrontation_235.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the 'find the weapon' beat was previously delivered by Dror Ragzlin

Confrontation_70.speaker: Narrator
Confrontation_70.text: *You attune your mind to it. The artefact does not want to part from you. It does not want to fall into the gith raiders' hands.*

Confrontation_0.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_0.text: I want something, yes. But I don't need you to be drawing breath in order to take it...

Confrontation_260.speaker: Player
Confrontation_260.text: I just want passage - if I have to go through you, so be it.

Confrontation_154.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_154.text: Chk! You dare speak to me like my better? Others have died for lesser insults - slowly.

Confrontation_141.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_141.text: But your bravery amuses me. Finally I find a wolf in a world of lowing cattle...

Confrontation_9.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_9.text: You may live. For the moment.

Confrontation_128.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_128.text: Now, we seek a weapon, taken from a vessel that fell from the sky. Understand, istik?

Confrontation_3.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_3.text: I gave you a chance to save your hide. Instead you chose empty bluster.

Confrontation_204.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_204.text: You are a waste of flesh. Perhaps the worms will have use for you.

Confrontation_179.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_179.text: Senseless creature - I don't want to dull my blade on your overly thick skull.

Confrontation_230.speaker: Player
Confrontation_230.text: I don't know you. I pose no threat.

Confrontation_28.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_28.text: Of course you are not a threat! You are nothing until I tell you otherwise.

Confrontation_189.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_189.text: Threat? Pah! You threaten me no more than the insects scrambling in the dirt.
Confrontation_189.context: NodeContext: Amused indignation - she can't believe you think you are worth anything

Confrontation_250.speaker: Player
Confrontation_250.text: Can't you muster a real threat, like flaying or blinding?

Confrontation_192.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_192.text: Chk! I can devise torments beyond your reckoning, rest assured. But time is pressing.

Confrontation_264.speaker: Player
Confrontation_264.text: Try it - let's see who walks away alive.

Confrontation_110.speaker: Player
Confrontation_110.text: Claim you're an important person. A valuable hostage - or ally.

Confrontation_45.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_45.text: No creature from this wretched world is important, half-wit.

Confrontation_36.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_36.text: The only value you hold is as meat to the carrion birds.

Confrontation_266.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation_266.text: Now, now, child - your pet means to speak. Tell me, pet: why shouldn't I run you through this instant?

PAD_Shield_1.speaker: Player
PAD_Shield_1.text: Still warm to the touch, if you can believe it.

PAD_Shield_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Shield_0.text: A dragon is clearly not to be trifled with.

PAD_Shield_2.speaker: Player
PAD_Shield_2.text: The shield is still warm to the touch. A dragon is not to be trifled with.

PAD_LeavingLaezelBehind_0.speaker: Player
PAD_LeavingLaezelBehind_0.text: Lae'zel is still back there. Should I just abandon her?

PAD_LeavingLaezelBehind_1.speaker: Player
PAD_LeavingLaezelBehind_1.text: It may not be the best idea.

Sign_AD_0.speaker: Narrator
Sign_AD_0.text: *Baldur's Gate: Northwest. Elturel: South. Moonrise Towers: West.*

AD_LaezelWithKnight_2.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelWithKnight_2.text: You do not understand. I heed Vlaakith's call.

AD_LaezelWithKnight_0.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
AD_LaezelWithKnight_0.text: And yet you do not heed her kith'rak's command.

AD_LaezelWithKnight_3.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
AD_LaezelWithKnight_3.text: Few of our Queen's children prove so stubborn.

AD_LaezelWithKnight_5.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
AD_LaezelWithKnight_5.text: Child of Vlaakith. Be still, and listen.

AD_LaezelWithKnight_7.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
AD_LaezelWithKnight_7.text: Do you not honour the command of a kith'rak, young one?

AD_LaezelWithKnight_4.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
AD_LaezelWithKnight_4.text: It is not your time to speak.

ZorruFriend_Dead_30.speaker: Narrator
ZorruFriend_Dead_30.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

ZorruFriend_Dead_25.speaker: Player
ZorruFriend_Dead_25.text: Yul? Then you are Zorru's friend?

ZorruFriend_Dead_38.speaker: Player
ZorruFriend_Dead_38.text: Were you and Zorru scouting alone?

ZorruFriend_Dead_23.speaker: Yul
ZorruFriend_Dead_23.text: Yes... Zorru fled... left me to fight...

ZorruFriend_Dead_36.speaker: Wyll
ZorruFriend_Dead_36.text: Zorru abandoned Yul to the githyanki. Damned coward.

ZorruFriend_Dead_6.speaker: Player
ZorruFriend_Dead_6.text: Where can I find the gith crèche?

ZorruFriend_Dead_4.speaker: Narrator
ZorruFriend_Dead_4.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

ZorruFriend_Dead_14.speaker: Player
ZorruFriend_Dead_14.text: Where can I find the gith crèche?

ZorruFriend_Dead_37.speaker: Yul
ZorruFriend_Dead_37.text: Monstrous warriors... keen swords... black spots...

ZorruFriend_Dead_12.speaker: Narrator
ZorruFriend_Dead_12.text: *To the tiefling scout, gith are monsters. To you, they are a sign: you are nearing the crèche.*

ZorruFriend_Dead_34.speaker: Lae'zel
ZorruFriend_Dead_34.text: He crossed blades with a githyanki. Few survive the ordeal. Fewer still claim victory.

ZorruFriend_Dead_16.speaker: Player
ZorruFriend_Dead_16.text: Where did this monstrous warrior come from?

ZorruFriend_Dead_24.speaker: Yul
ZorruFriend_Dead_24.text: No... with Zorru... fled to grove...

ZorruFriend_Dead_9.speaker: Player
ZorruFriend_Dead_9.text: Did you find the way to Baldur's Gate?

ZorruFriend_Dead_26.speaker: Yul
ZorruFriend_Dead_26.text: Miller... in Elturel... before its fall...

ZorruFriend_Dead_35.speaker: Narrator
ZorruFriend_Dead_35.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

TieflingScout_45.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_45.text: What are you doing?! Hold up, before they see you, mragreshem!
TieflingScout_45.context: NodeContext: mragreshem = infernal for 'shithead'. Pronounced mragRESHem.

TieflingScout_66.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_66.text: What, apart from the dragon? Look...
TieflingScout_66.context: NodeContext: Turns to look at the chokepoint

TieflingScout_55.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_55.text: That lot are swarming all over the bridge. I don't know what they want, but it can't be good.
TieflingScout_55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Tiefling points to/camera cuts to bridge and gith raiders.NodeContext: Referring to a bridge a short distance away. Some gith raiders have barricaded it.

TieflingScout_47.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_47.text: I'm going to find another way around. You ought to do the same.

TieflingScout_73.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_73.text: I doubt a fight against them would go your way.

TieflingScout_42.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_42.text: ... unless you're looking for a fight, that is.

TieflingScout_67.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_67.text: Nobody. Just another hrasting fool trying to get to Baldur's Gate in one piece.
TieflingScout_67.context: NodeContext: Hrasting pronounced hur-RAST-ing. Common language equivalent of damned/fucking,

TieflingScout_11.speaker: Player
TieflingScout_11.text: I might've been concerned, had I the slightest idea who 'they' are...

TieflingScout_68.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_68.context: CinematicNodeContext: Tiefling points to/camera cuts to bridge and gith raiders.

TieflingScout_61.speaker: Player
TieflingScout_61.text: Whatever you just called me, I didn't like the sound of it. Watch your tongue.

TieflingScout_43.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_43.text: Got more important things to watch than my hrasting tongue. Look...
TieflingScout_43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Tiefling points to/camera cuts to bridge and gith raiders.NodeContext: Hrasting pronounced hur-RAST-ing. Common language equivalent of damned/fucking,

TieflingScout_59.speaker: Player
TieflingScout_59.text: You're the mragreshem for taking that tone with me.

TieflingScout_33.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_33.text: Spare me. There's bigger problems right now that my manners. Look...
TieflingScout_33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Tiefling points to/camera cuts to bridge and gith raiders.

TieflingScout_10.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_10.text: Listen - avoid the bridge. I doubt a fight with that lot would go your way, no offence.

TieflingScout_54.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_54.text: I'm getting out of here. There's got to be another way to Baldur's Gate. Good luck.

TieflingScout_64.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_64.text: What? You going to try get past that lot? Better you than me.
TieflingScout_64.context: CinematicNodeContext: Tiefling points to/camera cuts to bridge and gith raiders.NodeContext: 'That lot' being a band of gith warriors guarding a nearby bridge.

TieflingScout_49.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_49.text: Hrast, another one! Keep back, flatface - I know how to handle myself!
TieflingScout_49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ellyka is immediately defensive, brandishing a dagger at the gith player.NodeContext: Hrast pronounced hur-RAST-ing. Similar to damn/fuck in common language.

TieflingScout_76.speaker: Player
TieflingScout_76.text: Take it easy, I'm only disguised as a gith.

TieflingScout_46.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_46.text: What? Why...? Never mind. I don't want to know.

TieflingScout_26.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_26.text: So... you not looking to make trouble for me, are you? Whatever you are?

TieflingScout_53.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_53.text: ... good. I've enough trouble as it is - look at that lot down there.

TieflingScout_40.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_40.text: Those things you're masquerading as. Armed to the teeth. And they've a dragon.

TieflingScout_70.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_70.text: I was counting on crossing that bridge and heading to Baldur's Gate. To safety.

TieflingScout_63.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_63.text: Now I've got to find another way around. If you're smart, you will too. You're no match for that lot.

TieflingScout_52.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_52.text: Now I've got to find another way around. Take your chances against that lot if you like.

TieflingScout_25.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_25.text: Don't follow me - find your own way.

TieflingScout_2.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_2.text: Nobody. Just another hrasting fool trying to stay alive. There's plenty of us around.
TieflingScout_2.context: NodeContext: Hrasting pronounced hur-RAST-ing. Common language equivalent of damned/fucking,

TieflingScout_27.speaker: Player
TieflingScout_27.text: Seems you have good survival instincts - maybe you should join me instead.

TieflingScout_12.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_12.text: I go my own way. Alone.

TieflingScout_60.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_60.text: That's how you want it... fine.

TieflingScout_82.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_82.text: You're not like that lot at the bridge. I reckon I can handler you... come on!

TieflingScout_41.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_41.text: Let's see if you're actually as tough as your disguise makes you... come on!

TieflingScout_18.speaker: Player
TieflingScout_18.text: Lower your weapon. I shall let no istik stand between me and my rightful cleansing.

TieflingScout_34.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_34.text: Your hrasting friends are swarming all over the bridge down there.
TieflingScout_34.context: NodeContext: Hrasting pronounced hur-RAST-ing. Common language equivalent of damned/fucking,

TieflingScout_16.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_16.text: I won't let you warn them.

TieflingScout_14.speaker: Player
TieflingScout_14.text: It's a disguise. I'm not really a gith.

TieflingScout_58.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_58.text: Actually forget it. I need to get moving; there has to be another way to Baldur's Gate.

TieflingScout_72.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_72.text: I'd keep clear of that lot on the bridge unless you think your disguise'll fool them.

TieflingScout_0.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_0.text: That lot on the bridge are out for blood. Hope your disguise holds, if you try to get past.

TieflingScout_30.speaker: Player
TieflingScout_30.text: I am Lae'zel of K'liir. You will let me pass.

TieflingScout_57.speaker: Player
TieflingScout_57.text: If there are gith at the bridge, they're nothing to me.

TieflingScout_15.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_15.text: ... all right. I'm leaving. I have to get to Baldur's Gate. Don't follow. And not a word to them.

TieflingScout_75.speaker: Player
TieflingScout_75.text: I have kin nearby? I should seek them out.

TieflingScout_13.speaker: Player
TieflingScout_13.text: First and last warning - lower that weapon.

TieflingScout_32.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_32.text: I'll drop it when you're dead.

TieflingScout_6.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_6.text: Your friends at the bridge are too much for me to take on... but I reckon I can handle you.

TieflingScout_8.speaker: Player
TieflingScout_8.text: I have no interest in harming you, unless you force my hand.
TieflingScout_8.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the player has the REALLY_GITHYANKI tag

TieflingScout_50.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_50.text: ... aren't you with that other lot? Down at the bridge? The ones with the dragon?
TieflingScout_50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Tiefling gestures to/camera highlights the chokepoint githyanki.

TieflingScout_81.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_81.text: All right. Maybe we don't have a problem then. Maybe.

TieflingScout_39.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_39.text: That bridge was going to be my passage to Baldur's Gate. To safety. Now I've to find another way.

TieflingScout_44.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_44.text: I'm leaving. Don't follow. Don't tell them you saw me.

TieflingScout_28.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_28.text: They're out for blood. Unless you're in good standing with them, I'd keep clear.

TieflingScout_24.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_24.text: They're out for blood. I hope you're in good standing with them.

TieflingScout_31.speaker: Player
TieflingScout_31.text: They may be my kin. I will investigate.

TieflingScout_19.speaker: Player
TieflingScout_19.text: I am Lae'zel of K'liir. You will let me pass.

TieflingScout_80.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_80.text: Then we've a problem. I can't have you running off to tell your friends about me.

TieflingScout_51.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_51.text: That lot are too much for me to take on... but I reckon I can handle you, mragreshem.
TieflingScout_51.context: NodeContext: mragreshem = infernal for 'shithead'. Pronounced mragRESHem.

TieflingScout_74.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_74.text: I'm going to have to be sure you stay quiet, mragreshem.
TieflingScout_74.context: NodeContext: mragreshem = infernal for 'shithead'. Pronounced mragRESHem.

TieflingScout_62.speaker: Player
TieflingScout_62.text: Calm yourself. I am not who you think I am.
TieflingScout_62.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the player is Planar and looks githyanki, but is not in fact githyanki.

TieflingScout_69.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout_69.text: Come on, mragreshem! I'll take my chances against you than your friends on the bridge!
TieflingScout_69.context: NodeContext: mragreshem = infernal for 'shithead'. Pronounced mragRESHem.

PAD_LaezelReadMap_0.speaker: Lae'zel
PAD_LaezelReadMap_0.text: A githyanki crèche lies beyond the mountain pass.

AD_GithCaptainFirstTurn_0.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_GithCaptainFirstTurn_0.text: You are outmatched. An inglorious bloodletting awaits.

AD_ScoutLeaves_0.speaker: Ellyka
AD_ScoutLeaves_0.text: Mrag! That's it - I'm getting out of here!
AD_ScoutLeaves_0.context: NodeContext: Mrag pronounced 'mRAG' (means 'shit' in infernal language). The tiefling decides that things are getting too dangerous and runs off while she still can.

ConfrontationLaezel_28.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontationLaezel_28.text: Stay put, and keep your lips sealed.
ConfrontationLaezel_28.context: InternalNodeContext: Edge-case: Lae'zel failed to be re-added automatically to the party because the party was full. Normally, she is readded and her OM plays instead of this dialog.

ConfrontationLaezel_38.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontationLaezel_38.text: Rider - my time is short. Lead me to...
ConfrontationLaezel_38.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel begins to bow as she speaks to the kith'rak

ConfrontationLaezel_43.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
ConfrontationLaezel_43.text: Were I not merciful, I would slice the skin clean from your meat.

ConfrontationLaezel_5.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
ConfrontationLaezel_5.text: Yet you are not bleeding. For I am nothing if not merciful.

ConfrontationLaezel_77.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontationLaezel_77.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Laezel, martial bowNodeContext: Lae'zel stays bowed as she speaks to the kith'rak

ConfrontationLaezel_54.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
ConfrontationLaezel_54.text: You will call me Jhe'stil Kith'rak.
ConfrontationLaezel_54.context: NodeContext: zhe-STIL KITH-rack. (First consonant like the first letter of 'Jacque'.)

ConfrontationLaezel_1.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontationLaezel_1.text: Voss, Knight Supreme. The queen's silver, the queen's sword.

ConfrontationLaezel_6.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
ConfrontationLaezel_6.text: A ghaik vessel has fallen from the sky, Lae'zel. Thieves aboard have taken a weapon most precious.

ConfrontationLaezel_34.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
ConfrontationLaezel_34.text: It is polyhedric in shape, and inscribed with the sacred runes of our people.

ConfrontationLaezel_70.speaker: Narrator
ConfrontationLaezel_70.text: *You feel Shadowheart's anxiety. The weapon that Voss seeks is the same one the Absolute's followers are hunting - it's the artefact that she carries.*
ConfrontationLaezel_70.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart steals a glance to Tav, her expression tight, apprehensive. The image of her undulates slightly - a mindmeld.InternalNodeContext: This node if the 'find the weapon' beat was previously delivered by Dror Ragzlin

ConfrontationLaezel_4.speaker: Narrator
ConfrontationLaezel_4.text: *Her mind focuses - the giths' suspicion cannot be aroused. They cannot discover that the weapon they seek is right within their grasp.*
ConfrontationLaezel_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart's eyes flick over to the hobgoblin.

ConfrontationLaezel_27.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
ConfrontationLaezel_27.text: Take word to your crèche. You are to join our search.

ConfrontationLaezel_44.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
ConfrontationLaezel_44.text: Speak up, child. Affirm your mandate.

ConfrontationLaezel_17.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontationLaezel_17.text: My mandate, Jhe'stil Kith'rak, is to locate this crèche. I was infected aboard a ghaik ship and need to be purified. Your mandate is to aid me.
ConfrontationLaezel_17.context: NodeContext: Snotty and confident, stays bowed as she speaks to the kith'rak

ConfrontationLaezel_66.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
ConfrontationLaezel_66.text: Purified? Oh, Lae'zel - why must the truth be so bitter? Soon, your skin will go grey, and your blood will run silver. You will shed your skin to become ghaik.

ConfrontationLaezel_20.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
ConfrontationLaezel_20.text: Only in death are the infected cleansed.

ConfrontationLaezel_21.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
ConfrontationLaezel_21.text: But... you were on the nautiloid. You possess what I seek.

ConfrontationLaezel_7.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
ConfrontationLaezel_7.text: You will give it to us. Then you will bend your head for the sword.

ConfrontationLaezel_60.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontationLaezel_60.text: Stand down, knight. I do not have what you seek!
ConfrontationLaezel_60.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel looks up from bowing at the kith'rak.

ConfrontationLaezel_55.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
ConfrontationLaezel_55.text: Baretha - see her skull split and her corpse examined. I will take word to Queen Vlaakith - our quest has ended.

ConfrontationLaezel_36.speaker: Narrator
ConfrontationLaezel_36.text: *A current of deception carries Voss' words. Wherever he flies, it is not to Vlaakith.*

ConfrontationLaezel_11.speaker: Player
ConfrontationLaezel_11.text: Produce the artefact. You're looking for this, I take it?

ConfrontationLaezel_51.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
ConfrontationLaezel_51.text: Our thieves come forth, Baretha. Did you imagine such fortune?

ConfrontationLaezel_32.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontationLaezel_32.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel looks up from bowing at the player in anger

ConfrontationLaezel_56.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
ConfrontationLaezel_56.text: You will give us the weapon. Then you will bend your head for the sword.

ConfrontationLaezel_2.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontationLaezel_2.text: Never. Vlaakith demands my purity, Kith'rak. I was infected aboard the ghaik ship. By protocol, you must aid me.

ConfrontationLaezel_57.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
ConfrontationLaezel_57.text: Baretha, see that her skull is split and the weapon collected, on Vlaakith's command. I will take word to the Undying Queen - our quest has ended.

ConfrontationLaezel_35.speaker: Player
ConfrontationLaezel_35.text: I have my own mandate. Time to die, gith.

ConfrontationLaezel_73.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontationLaezel_73.text: What? Half-wit! I have not suffered for you to deny me!
ConfrontationLaezel_73.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel looks up from bowing at the player in anger

ConfrontationLaezel_47.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
ConfrontationLaezel_47.text: Baretha - see their skulls split and their corpses examined. I must fly to our Undying Queen.

ConfrontationLaezel_72.speaker: Narrator
ConfrontationLaezel_72.text: *You feel Shadowheart's anxiety. The weapon that Voss seeks - it's the artefact that she carries.*
ConfrontationLaezel_72.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart steals a glance to Tav, her expression tight, apprehensive. The image of her undulates slightly - a mindmeld.

ConfrontationLaezel_75.speaker: Narrator
ConfrontationLaezel_75.text: *You realise that the weapon Voss speaks of is the gith artefact you carry. You must keep it from him, just as you must keep it from the Absolute.*
ConfrontationLaezel_75.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the 'find the weapon' beat was previously delivered by Dror Ragzlin

ConfrontationLaezel_0.speaker: Narrator
ConfrontationLaezel_0.text: *You realise that the weapon Voss speaks of is the gith artefact you carry. You cannot let him discover it - no matter what.*

ConfrontationLaezel_12.speaker: Narrator
ConfrontationLaezel_12.text: *You suddenly feel a strange anxiety take hold - not your own, but that of the artefact you carry. Somehow, it's afraid...*
ConfrontationLaezel_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player glances to their side, as if sensing the box

ConfrontationLaezel_15.speaker: Narrator
ConfrontationLaezel_15.text: *You attune your mind to it. The artefact does not want to fall into the gith raiders' hands any more than it does the Absolute followers'.*
ConfrontationLaezel_15.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the 'find the weapon' beat was previously delivered by Dror Ragzlin

ConfrontationLaezel_13.speaker: Narrator
ConfrontationLaezel_13.text: *You attune your mind to it. The artefact does not want to part from you. It does not want to fall into the gith raiders' hands.*

ConfrontationLaezel_9.speaker: Player
ConfrontationLaezel_9.text: If you wish to speak, speak to me.

ConfrontationLaezel_74.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontationLaezel_74.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel looks up from bowing at the player in anger

ConfrontationLaezel_26.speaker: Player
ConfrontationLaezel_26.text: Step forward and state your own name.

ConfrontationLaezel_24.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontationLaezel_24.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel looks up from bowing at the player in anger

ConfrontationLaezel_65.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
ConfrontationLaezel_65.text: Now, now - Vlaakith esteems all her children.

ConfrontationLaezel_42.speaker: Narrator
ConfrontationLaezel_42.text: *Your skull pounds in response to the githyanki's white-hot stare. Her lips don't move, yet you hear her voice.*

ConfrontationLaezel_14.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontationLaezel_14.text: You. Stay put, and keep your lips sealed.

ConfrontationLaezel_48.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontationLaezel_48.text: You. Stay put, and keep your lips sealed.

PAD_DragonShadow_0.speaker: Player
PAD_DragonShadow_0.text: A dragon-rider. My kin are hunting - blood will be spilled.

PAD_DragonShadow_2.speaker: Player
PAD_DragonShadow_2.text: A dragon-rider - my kin are near.

PAD_DragonShadow_4.speaker: Player
PAD_DragonShadow_4.text: Look at that beast. Seems almost too big to take flight.

PAD_DragonShadow_3.speaker: Player
PAD_DragonShadow_3.context: NodeContext: (Responding to previous speaker) unnerved at the sight of a dragon flying overhead

PAD_DragonShadow_5.speaker: Player
PAD_DragonShadow_5.text: That thing could swallow each of us whole.

PAD_DragonShadow_7.speaker: Player
PAD_DragonShadow_7.text: A thing like that could swallow each of us whole - raw or incinerated.

PAD_DragonShadow_8.speaker: Player
PAD_DragonShadow_8.text: Damn thing could blot out the sun.

PAD_DragonShadow_9.speaker: Player
PAD_DragonShadow_9.context: NodeContext: Unnerved at the sight of a dragon flying overhead

AD_StandOff_0.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_StandOff_0.text: Your babbling tires me, istik. Move your carcass!
AD_StandOff_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Authoritative demandingNodeContext: Authoritative demanding. 'istik' =  'Stranger' - Catch-all term for non-gith. Pronounced Iss-tick

AD_StandOff_1.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
AD_StandOff_1.text: B-by order of the Flaming Fist, halt!
AD_StandOff_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Unintelligent confusionNodeContext: Unintelligent confusion

AD_StandOff_2.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_StandOff_2.text: Or what? Show us what you can do, worm.
AD_StandOff_2.context: NodeContext: Htak'-a meaning "Die!" in gith language

CINE_RiderAndDragonLeave_0.context:
CinematicNodeContext: ~The dragon spreads its wings and soars away.
NOTE: this could be used in a number of circumstances in which Voss flies away. Voss is an arrogant senior gith officer, focused on his mission, so he can always depart while being unfazed by preceeding events.

PAD_LaezelPostFight_0.speaker: Lae'zel
PAD_LaezelPostFight_0.text: Their corpses may have something of use...

AD_SearchingCorpses_6.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_SearchingCorpses_6.context: NodeContext: Kith'rak - 'Captain' - a gith commander in charge of ten sarths (100 warriors total). Pronounced Kith-rack

AD_SearchingCorpses_2.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_SearchingCorpses_2.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith pronounced v-lah-kith. The name of the gith queen.

AD_SearchingCorpses_7.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
AD_SearchingCorpses_7.text: I expect you to fall on your sword, if you do.
AD_SearchingCorpses_7.context: NodeContext: Baretha pronounced Bar-eh-tha. A gith name.

AD_SearchingCorpses_4.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
AD_SearchingCorpses_4.text: Get to work, Baretha! Search the dead!
AD_SearchingCorpses_4.context: NodeContext: Baretha pronounced Bar-eh-tha. A gith name.

AD_SearchingCorpses_0.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_SearchingCorpses_0.context: NodeContext: Kith'rak - 'Captain' - a gith commander in charge of ten sarths (100 warriors total). Pronounced Kith-rack

AD_SearchingCorpses_5.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_SearchingCorpses_5.text: You heard him - search every corpse!
AD_SearchingCorpses_5.context: NodeContext: Directed towards the other two gith warriors who are present.

AD_SearchingCorpses_8.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
AD_SearchingCorpses_8.text: Keep looking! Someone in this wretched world has what we need.

AD_SearchingCorpses_3.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_SearchingCorpses_3.text: Yes, Kith'rak. We shall find it.
AD_SearchingCorpses_3.context: NodeContext: Kith'rak - 'Captain' - a gith commander in charge of ten sarths (100 warriors total). Pronounced Kith-rack

DragonEvent_1.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
DragonEvent_1.context: NodeContext: Trying to be authoritative, but completely in over his head.

DragonEvent_6.speaker: Sarth Baretha
DragonEvent_6.text: I'll feed your innards to the ants before I do that, istik.

DragonEvent_8.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
DragonEvent_8.context: NodeContext: Last-ditch effort to enforce authority.

DragonEvent_7.speaker: Sarth Baretha
DragonEvent_7.text: No, look up. That was your last chance, istik. Now burn!
DragonEvent_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: A dragon appears and does an air-to-ground attack, roasting the Flaming Fists. It goes to land somewhere and its rider, Kith'rak Voss, dismounts. He approaches the other githyanki.InternalNodeContext: Dragon destroys bridge, dragon lands, knight starts talking to BarethaNodeContext: 'I'm done with you'.

DragonEvent_2.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
DragonEvent_2.text: Stop wasting time, Baretha. You're not here to play with the locals.
DragonEvent_2.context: NodeContext: Berating an underling. Baretha pronounced Bar-eh-tha. A gith name.

DragonEvent_5.speaker: Sarth Baretha
DragonEvent_5.text: Of course, kith'rak. We merely sought to -
DragonEvent_5.context: NodeContext: Kith'rak - 'Captain' - a gith commander in charge of ten sarths (100 warriors total). Pronounced Kith-rack

DragonEvent_9.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
DragonEvent_9.text: No excuses. Question, kill, then move on. Find the weapon.

DragonEvent_0.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
DragonEvent_0.text: Our queen watches us. Fail her at your peril.

DragonEvent_3.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
DragonEvent_3.context: NodeContext: Trying to be authoritative, but completely in over his head.

DragonEvent_4.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
DragonEvent_4.context: NodeContext: Trying to be authoritative, but completely in over his head.

DragonEvent_10.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
DragonEvent_10.context: NodeContext: Trying to be authoritative, but completely in over his head.

PartyReaction_0.speaker: Player
PartyReaction_0.text: Facing that lot would be suicide... at least for now.

PartyReaction_1.speaker: Player
PartyReaction_1.text: They'll be tough to fight... but not impossible to beat.
PartyReaction_1.context: InternalNodeContext: Script couldn't find a nearby companion, so the controlled character is talking to themselves

PartyReaction_2.speaker: Player
PartyReaction_2.text: My kin wield their spears formidably. It would be foolish to provoke battle with them now.
PartyReaction_2.context: InternalNodeContext: This is for Lae'zel AVATAR or when she's alone as a companion (otherwise there's a WRD instead)

PartyReaction_3.speaker: Player
PartyReaction_3.text: These gith are formidable - but not infallible. We can take them in battle, should it come to that.

PartyReaction_5.speaker: Player
PartyReaction_5.text: Let's see if they want to have their blood spilled.

PartyReaction_4.speaker: Player
PartyReaction_4.text: You'd have to be a fool to pick a fight with that lot. Best to keep away for now...

PartyReaction_6.speaker: Player
PartyReaction_6.text: Githyanki! I must speak with them - a crèche must be near.
PartyReaction_6.context: InternalNodeContext: This is for Lae'zel AVATAR or when she's alone as a companion (otherwise there's a WRD instead)

PartyReaction_7.speaker: Player
PartyReaction_7.text: I reckon those warriors holding the bridge can be fought off... if it comes to that.

PartyReaction_8.speaker: Player
PartyReaction_8.text: My kin wield their spears formidably. It would be foolish to provoke battle with them now.

AD_ScoutReactsToDragon_0.speaker: Ellyka
AD_ScoutReactsToDragon_0.text: Helm protect me, where'd that beast come from...?
AD_ScoutReactsToDragon_0.context: NodeContext: A tiefling refugee reacts with terror and awe upon seeing a dragon fly overhead.

AD_LaezelSidesWithGith_0.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelSidesWithGith_0.text: I should have ended you when I had the chance.
AD_LaezelSidesWithGith_0.context: InternalNodeContext: She was never a companion

AD_LaezelSidesWithGith_1.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelSidesWithGith_1.text: Shka'keth! I will tolerate you no longer.
AD_LaezelSidesWithGith_1.context: InternalNodeContext: She was in the player's party, but they decided to manually attack the gith before triggering the confrontation dialog, so she sides with the gith
